image.altText: Concept art showing interior of sports stadium with cricket match underway.

props.synopsis: If it wasn't already official, it is now: The proposed Hobart stadium is massively on the nose among many Tasmanians, especially in the Liberal stronghold of the north-west.

title.children: Poll reveals support levels for proposed Hobart stadium across Tasmania

image.altText: Unidentified Tasmania Police officers in parade uniform standing in line.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian police officer who was on Sunday charged with accessing child abuse material was last year awarded a police medal for his work with at-risk youth and youth crime. Police say the medal will be reviewed.

title.children: Officer facing child abuse charge last year awarded for work with at-risk youth

image.altText: Dr Jay Shoemaker photographed in medical consulting room.

props.synopsis: Two siblings running a clinic in Tasmania, which has the country's worst bulk-billing rate, say the new Medicare model proposed by Labor isn't viable at their practice for standard adult appointments.

title.children: New bulk-billing funding won't sway this GP clinic

image.altText: a man in white basketball uniform with a basketball

props.synopsis: Tasmania's basketball pathways have put a score on the board with the signing of Burnie-born Taran Armstrong to US NBA team Golden State Warriors.

title.children: Tasmanian 'elite talent' US bound after NBA signing

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in a Tasmanian court via phone to face allegations he stole a car in the Huon Valley, south of Hobart.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann faces Hobart court on car theft charge

image.altText: A racing greyhound highlighted mid-race.

props.synopsis: Animal welfare activists are concerned the "true breadth of racing-related deaths" in the greyhound industry are unknown.

title.children: This was Supreme Caesar's final race before it died, earning $0 for its owner

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Network Ten is ordered to pay journalist Lisa Wilkinson more than $1 million to cover costs incurred for her personal legal representation in the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case.

title.children: Network Ten ordered to pay Lisa Wilkinson $1.15m for court costs

image.altText: a close up of the microsoft logo, a window coloured red, green, blue, yellow

props.synopsis: Microsoft has increased the price of its Microsoft 365 subscriptions, which it says has new AI features, but the price hike caused consumer outrage.

title.children: 'Arrogance is astounding': Microsoft subscription price hike brings backlash

image.altText: A bald man with a grey long beard stares at the cmaera. Fair skin, elderly and blue eyes. Close up image.

props.synopsis: Long-term residents of a WA caravan park say they feel let down after being told they have six months to find somewhere else to live.

title.children: Pensioners evicted from caravan park despite living there for decades

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: With land cheaper in the outer suburbs, families are opting to live in neighbourhoods that often lack basic health, education, retail and transport services. How long does it take for people to comfortably call these places home?

title.children: 'Urban sprawl is failing': The tyranny of distance in Australia's outer suburbs

image.altText: Proxy twins visit Queensland hospital

props.synopsis: Last year saw an increase in the number of organ donors, but as donors age and families refuse permission, fewer Australians are receiving life-saving donations.

title.children: Twin boys get life-saving organ transplants weeks apart

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping. Both are wearing a blue suit, blue tie and have a neutral facial expression.

props.synopsis: China's economic fortunes were improving before Donald Trump's re-election, but his return to the White House seems to have inspired Xi Jinping to bring Beijing's business leaders in from the cold.

title.children: China's economic fortunes have turned, and it may be thanks to Trump

image.altText: Sun rising over Mars taken from orbiting spacecraft.

props.synopsis: Strange, tilted geological formations spotted on Mars may be ancient beaches on the shore of a huge ocean, data from China's Zhurong rover suggests.

title.children: 'Ocean on Mars' theory solidifies as rover detects 'hidden beaches'

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Airservices Australia representatives tell a parliamentary hearing that almost 50 flights were forced to divert after China signalled it was conducting the hazardous drills in busy international airspace.

title.children: Virgin Airlines pilot first to alert authorities on Chinese live fire danger

image.altText: Cairns watch house

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old boy with a disability was allegedly tormented by an older child in a Queensland watch house for more than an hour, despite the area being covered by CCTV.

title.children: Teen charged over alleged assault of disabled boy in police watch house

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Flood plume from Burdekin River captured on Feb 18 Courtesy Copernicus Sentinel 2

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery reveals huge amounts of floodwater heading into the ocean and towards parts of the Great Barrier Reef ahead of more potential severe weather.

title.children: Satellite photos show flood run-off flowing towards parts of Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: Woodside office with sign clearly showing, in Perth

props.synopsis: Australian shares lose ground after a mixed lead from Wall Street, while Woodside Energy reports a full-year profit up 115 per cent. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Woodside Energy more than doubles profit to $3.6b, ASX down

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: South Korea cuts interest rates by another 25 basis points
Domino's shares down 10 per cent on loss

image.altText: black and white photo of John F Kennedy car with person standing over

props.synopsis: Clint Hill received Secret Service awards and was promoted for his actions that day, but for decades blamed himself for the US president's death.

title.children: Secret Service agent who tried to save JFK dies at 93

image.altText: Unidentified woman receives a mammogram.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists said an aging population, alcohol consumption and low physical activity could all be contributing to the country's high breast cancer rate.

title.children: Australians record highest breast cancer diagnosis rate in the world

image.altText: man with tower in bakground

props.synopsis: Mobile voice and SMS connectivity would be extended across Australia under a Labor election pledge to update Australia's universal service obligation.

title.children: Labor pledges to expand voice and SMS coverage across Australia

image.altText: A man chips away at the Berlin Wall with a pickaxe as East Berlin border guards look on from above.

props.synopsis: When word of crowds gathering at the Berlin Wall reached Europe correspondent Ian Henderson on a cold November day in 1989, no one believed it would ultimately lead to its fall.

title.children: 'Like a three-day carnival': Watching the fall of the Berlin Wall

image.altText: A black and white photo of Roberta Black on the red carpet of the Grammy Awards.

props.synopsis: Flack shot to fame in the 1970s for her hit records 'The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face' and 'Killing Me Softly With His Song'.

title.children: Grammy Award-winning singer Roberta Flack dies aged 88

image.altText: Aerial shot of five large homes with a sold sign in red on the side

props.synopsis: The rezoning of land around 39 train and metro stations last year to increase housing density is set to radically change the character of upper north shore town centres.

title.children: Neighbours prepare to sell to developers in rezoned Sydney suburbs

image.altText: Two nuns bow their heads.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was admitted to hospital in Rome on February 14 with breathing difficulties and his clinical picture has been described as "complex" and "critical".

title.children: Public prayers for Pope after 'slight improvement', prognosis 'not decided'

image.altText: Composite image of Morgan Smithies (left) and Hudson Young (right) running the ball for the Canberra Raiders in NRL games.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders pair Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies apologise for an incident in a Las Vegas hotel that saw the two "really good mates" briefly kicked out of the building.

title.children: Raiders pair Young and Smithies apologise for Las Vegas 'scuffle'

image.altText: An empty market shed.

props.synopsis: Fruit and vegetable traders at Melbourne's famous Queen Victoria Market are accusing the City of Melbourne of financial mismanagement and say they are paying unfair costs.

title.children: Queen Victoria Market traders strike for first time in history

image.altText: Jimmy Barnes thumbnail image

props.synopsis: Australian rocker Jimmy Barnes, who has been battling a series of health issues in recent years, says he wrote many of his new songs from a hospital bed.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes says he wrote many new songs while 'incapacitated' in hospital

image.altText: Woman in red scarf and black hijab stands in a well decorated room with green walls, green and gold cushions, carpet, curtains.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says its soldiers fired into the home in a small village near the city of Jenin because they believed Palestinian militants were inside. Instead, the gunfire left a young mother covered in her only child's blood.

title.children: Mum says 'world should do something' as 2yo dies in Israeli strike

image.altText: Jack Ginnivan, Nick Watson and Connor Macdonald sit on the fence to celebrate with Hawks fans

props.synopsis: Hawthorn was one of the stories of 2024, winning admirers and driving opponents crazy in equal measure. Now in 2025, the Hawks have an oversized target on their backs.

title.children: The hunted and hated Hawks are ready to take on the world

image.altText: A woman in a CFA yellow uniform shown before behind as she watches a giant cloud of bushfire smoke.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils warn the state's new emergency services fund is too expensive for ratepayers, and say it is unfair on councils.

title.children: Victorian councils warn new emergency services 'tax' will hurt ratepayers

image.altText: A head and shoulder shot of Roger Cook during the debate.

props.synopsis: In a hasty debate that tried to race through hot-button issues like cost of living and crime, viewers were left with little new detail.

title.children: Gaffes and stumbles sideline only WA leaders' debate as early voting begins

image.altText: A red helicopter takes off under grey skies.

props.synopsis: Amid catastrophic floods in Ingham, dialysis patient Sofie Pearson says she had to take drastic measures to evacuate for the life-saving treatment.

title.children: Patient used jetski, private helicopter to access dialysis in floods

image.altText: A dog sniffs a tyre

props.synopsis: Plant debris, insects and weed seeds can lurk under mudflaps and are all hard to spot with the untrained eye. But it's a job that English springer spaniel Alice was made for.

title.children: Sniffer dogs inspect cars heading to K'gari to halt invasive species

image.altText: Dorcy Rugamba looking up and to the side, standing with arms folded, slightly smiling.

props.synopsis: One of the stand-out shows at this year's Adelaide Festival is a devastating performance of love for family and for country. In it, audiences hear from a renowned Rwandan playwright who refused to let anger ruin him.

title.children: When Dorcy's family were killed, anger froze him. Telling his story helped
